intro: Hieracium stricticaule, commonly known as the upright hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads and serrated leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with upright stems that are often hairy. Its flowers are yellow and bloom in late summer, producing small seeds that are dispersed by the wind. Hieracium stricticaule is often found in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, and it is considered a common weed in agricultural areas.
